arm_group.description: Smokers enter a Mindfulness Training for Smokers course
Smokers attempt smoking cessation with the help of the Wisconsin Tobacco Quit Line

brief_summary.textblock:
The Meriter Smoking Cessation Study tests participants in the Meriter Smoking Cessation
      Program.  Meriter Hospital and clinic patients will be recruited into the Meriter Smoking
      Cessation Program. The Meriter Smoking Cessation Program has two interventions, the
      Mindfulness Training for Smokers (MTS) intervention and the Quit Line (QL) Intervention.
      Study activities include one 10-minute study visit and two 5-minute survey phone calls.

clinical_study.brief_title: Meriter Mindfulness Training for Smokers Program and Study

detailed_description.textblock:
The Meriter Smoking Cessation Study tests participants in the Meriter Smoking Cessation
      Program.  Meriter Hospital and clinic patients will be recruited into the Meriter Smoking
      Cessation Program. The Meriter Smoking Cessation Program has two interventions, the
      Mindfulness Training for Smokers (MTS) intervention and the Quit Line (QL) Intervention.
      Study activities include one 10-minute study visit and two 5-minute survey phone calls.

      MTS: Mindfulness Training for Smokers Intervention. This is the 7-week quit smoking
      intervention developed by the PI.

      QL:  Quit Line Intervention.  This is a program starting at makes use of the Wisconsin
      Tobacco Quit Line.

      Meriter Smoking Cessation Program:  A program offering the MTS and QL interventions to
      smokers at Meriter Hospital and Clinics.

      Meriter Smoking Cessation Study: This is a study comprised of 2 phone surveys and 1 study
      visit that tests participants in the MTS and QL intervention.  Participants in the Meriter
      Smoking cessation program will have the opportunity to decide if they would like to be in
      the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  everyday smoker

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  current alcohol or other drug addiction

intervention.description: Group behavioral intervention using mindfulness to help smokers quit smoking

link.description: Pilot randomized trial on mindfulness training for smokers in young adult binge drinkers

clinical_study.official_title: Meriter Mindfulness Training for Smokers Program and Study

primary_outcome.description: Carbon monoxide levels are obtained 10 days post quit.  CO under 7 = abstinence.
primary_outcome.measure: biochemically confirmed post treatment smoking abstinence

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: James Davis, MD, Assistant Professor, Department of Medicine

results_reference.citation: Davis JM, Mills DM, Stankevitz KA, Manley AR, Majeskie MR, Smith SS. Pilot randomized trial on mindfulness training for smokers in young adult binge drinkers. BMC Complement Altern Med. 2013 Sep 3;13:215. doi: 10.1186/1472-6882-13-215.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
